sentence.text: I tied the points of my hose , pushing down my shirt , glad to protect myself against the unearthly chill in that ghastly chamber .
The favourite sat up and grabbed the cup so hastily splashes of wine fell on his silken , multi-coloured hose .
Wearing tunic and hose of pale blue satin lavishly ornamented with silver , he looked more angelic than ever .
The nurse discussed with Mrs Fellows the importance of taking short walks , not sitting with her legs crossed and the continued wearing of support hose in the pre-operative period .
The men 's blouses and hose were blue ; three-quarters of the women 's gowns were blue .
Corbett was immediately struck by the fellow 's swarthy good looks and elegant dress : dark purple hose , soft buskins on his feet , and an open-necked , spotless , white cambric shirt .
He was dressed in a rich robe of gold , fringed with black velvet , over a doublet of blood-red silk and black and white hose .
Santerre had changed into a doublet and hose of grey-silver whilst his wife and daughter both looked resplendent in gowns of blue satin trimmed with gold .
To see and smell the greasy rags of the poor ; the silk-slashed , perfumed doublets , velvet hose and precious buckled shoes of the rich .
Only that would explain his short lace-trimmed jerkin and the tight red hose .
On his legs were hose striped with red and gold , while his feet were hidden in crimson velvet slippers with silver roses on the toes .
He was a wealthy man these days , and dressed in doublet and hose with a gold chain round his neck .
They were dressed simply in hose and open-necked shirts .
If you think of the Elizabethan era , even the men wore hose did n't they ?
Banners were lowered , and behind the pavilions came a procession led by pages in tight quilted jackets , multi-coloured hose and gaudy feathered hats .
Nineteenth-century legs were no longer to be clad in fancy hose , and by 1810 with most of even the skilled stockingers crowded into the plain branch , prices and wages began to tumble .
